metadata.Title: CVE-2018-4373 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple memory corruption issues were addressed with improved memory handling. This issue affected versions prior to iOS 12.1, watchOS 5.1, Safari 12.0.1, iTunes 12.9.1, iCloud for Windows 7.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-4373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.22.3-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.22.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.22.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.22.3-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.22.3-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.22.3-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.22.3-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.22.3-1').
